name: LaNe Silikon-Trennmittel oliv (Art. 82785 ff.)
hazard_category: Not classified as hazardous under CLP; weakly water-hazardous (WGK 1)
hazards_description: Mixture of hydroxy-terminated polydimethylsiloxane (silicone release agent) without classified dangerous ingredients; product is not classified as hazardous according to CLP and not subject to mandatory labelling under GefStoffV.[attached_file:file:17] Not explosive, not self-igniting, but can form carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide on combustion; spilled material creates slip hazard on floors.[attached_file:file:17]

composition.description: Hydroxy-terminated polydimethylsiloxane mixture; no dangerous components requiring classification are listed.[attached_file:file:17]

protective_measures: Observe normal precautions when handling chemicals. Open and handle containers carefully; keep containers tightly closed. Ensure adequate general ventilation. Keep away from oxidizing agents and foodstuffs. Store cool, dry, protected from heat, direct sunlight, and frost at 20–25 °C in well-ventilated rooms; keep containers dry and tightly closed.[attached_file:file:17] Wear suitable protective gloves, safety goggles during decanting, and protective work clothing; select glove material based on breakthrough times and resistance, as no specific recommendation is possible for this preparation.[attached_file:file:17]
emergency_procedures: In case of accidental release, beware of slip hazard. Provide adequate ventilation and wear personal protective clothing. Prevent entry into drains and water bodies. Absorb with liquid-binding material such as sand, diatomaceous earth, acid binder, universal binder, or sawdust, and dispose of according to Section 13.[attached_file:file:17] For fire, use CO₂, dry powder, water spray, or alcohol-resistant foam; avoid full water jet. Combustion may produce carbon monoxide; wear breathing apparatus.[attached_file:file:17]

first_aid.inhalation: Provide fresh air; consult a physician if symptoms occur.[attached_file:file:17]
first_aid.skin_contact: Remove contaminated clothing immediately. Dab affected skin areas with cotton or cellulose and then wash thoroughly with water and mild detergent.[attached_file:file:17]
first_aid.eye_contact: Rinse open eyes with running water for several minutes.[attached_file:file:17]
first_aid.ingestion: Consult a physician if complaints persist.[attached_file:file:17]

first_aider_reference: No specific acute or delayed symptoms or special medical treatment are indicated beyond standard symptomatic care.[attached_file:file:17]
fire_suppression: Suitable media: CO₂, dry powder, water spray; for larger fires, use water spray or alcohol-resistant foam. Unsuitable: full water jet. Wear respiratory protection; collect contaminated extinguishing water separately and prevent it from entering sewers.[attached_file:file:17]
disposal: Must be subjected to special treatment under official regulations; do not dispose of with household waste and do not allow to reach sewage systems. Dispose of uncleaned packaging in accordance with local regulations.[attached_file:file:17]
transport_classification: Not classified as dangerous goods for transport (ADR, ADN, IMDG, IATA); no UN number, no class, no packing group; not a marine pollutant.[attached_file:file:17]
environmental_hazard: No specific aquatic toxicity data available. Classified as weakly hazardous to water (WGK 1); do not allow large quantities, especially undiluted product, to enter groundwater, surface water, or sewage systems.[attached_file:file:17]
